website_summaries.verdict: Sturdy, compact, and adjustable. This budget-friendly booster seat offers excellent value for money.
pros: With two height adjustments and a removable tray, it easily adapts from an infant feeding seat to a toddler booster seat
Features a high back rest for comfort and support
Compact, folding design is portable and easy to store
Surprisingly durable considering the low price
cons: Seat cover feels flimsy and has a tendency to slide off

website_summaries.verdict: A value buy that is both versatile and practical for around half the price of others on our list.
pros: A 2-in-1 model that works as a baby and toddler booster seat
cons: Consumers noted that it runs a bit small to accommodate larger toddlers, but it fits up to 33 pounds

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this chair. I was able to put it together super quickly. It is small and compact, so I am able to take it with me if I am spending the day at my mom's house. But what I like the most is that my baby is secure and comfortable. I can hand him a toy and he will just play with it on this chair. Another good thing about booster seat is that it feels super secure. Once you attach it the straps they stay locked.
customer_reviews.author: Dayanara

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed in the condition of this product
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in the condition of this product! It arrived on my doorstep in a box that was not damaged at all. Upon opening that box there was another box that contained the product. That box had clearly been damaged and than retaped poorly! The fabric of the highchair was dirty and looked used and the base was broken and dirty as well. Returned and will not be purchasing again. Very low quality!
customer_reviews.author: scott britain

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my 5. 5 month old who ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5.5 month old who is 16 pounds and sits up very well. I only used this once and immediately returned it. The safety strap that holds the booster to a chair kept popping off every time I'd tug or shift the booster! I didn't feel safe leaving my baby in it if I wasn't sitting right next to him since the safety strap comes off and the chair could fall over. Also, the tray was insanely difficult to put on and take off, and took a lot of muscle and maneuvering. Overall it just felt cheaply made and not efficient or safe.
customer_reviews.author: Fawn L.

customer_reviews.title: Portable chair, good for travel. Not recommended as primary chair.
customer_reviews.text: The chair is good for something portable at the <$20 price point. We fold it up and take it on travel to grandparents, friends house for dinner, etc. However, it doesn't really seem comfortable (or large enough) to serve as a primary chair. A lot of reviewers complain about getting the tray on/off. While it is a little "tight" it's certainly not impossible and I am able to do it (I do need to use both hands to squeeze the levers while sliding it back). The best thing the chair has going for it is its portability - we fit it inside of a beach bag and take it as carry on when we fly.
customer_reviews.author: K.P.

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This chair is not for small infants who are just learning to sit. It has a very upright back and babies just learning to sit like to lean back or forward. There is not enough room for a baby to move forward and my baby is preemie so definitely lot smaller than other babies this age. Yet its a snug fit. I had bought a similar one but Toys R Us brand for my older one it was so much better. This is junk. Unfortunately I had bough it long ago with a bunch of other items from my registry so cant even return it now.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: How to best throw away $20....
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this seat as an outdoor option for our 1 year old. It’s is cheap plastic and even as you are putting it together, you can feel that it is going to fall apart. When we did sit my son in it, the buckles took forever to finally click in. The back “pad”, which can only be described as a Tiny piece of foam paper, does not stay on at all. Food falls in the space between the tray and the child- made a bigger mess than the usual 1 year old meal mess. I highly do NOT recommend this to anyone. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: C.L.

customer_reviews.title: awful
customer_reviews.text: This seat is horrible. The tray sticks, I have to brace the chair to hold it in place in order to remove the tray. And even then it is not that easy, so when a crying baby is sitting it, whew, not fun. The straps that hold the seat to the chair, seem really cheap and wouldn't tighten as much as I would like them too. The safety strap to hold your baby is not that great either, so as your baby grows into a toddler and wants to do it themselves, I don't think it will be that easy for them. I gave it a few days, returning it looking harder for the seat my toddler uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Affordable & convenient
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to use in our gazebo, since we eat dinner in there frequently this time of year. Because it's not her primary chair, I didn't want to spend a lot. I have a pop-n-sit portable seat that we used on many occasions for my son, but because the straps on that buckle more over the legs than across the wait it doesn't work well for my daughter because she likes to wiggle. I don't have to worry about her wiggling out of this. My only complaints are that it is a little difficult to unbuckle and the seat cushion doesn't stay in place well because it attaches only at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Erin P.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SEAT!
customer_reviews.text: This seat is SO flexible for what you might need for a visiting child. The durability is questionable, especially the tray, but the seat itself seems fine. It goes to multiple heights, sits on the floor or a chair or table just fine, and has all the proper buckles. I INSTANTLY wished I had bought 2 for all of our grandkids. If you have a kid who is not HARD on things, you'll love it. If you own a little monster, you might look for something more rugged and reinforced.
customer_reviews.author: P. Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the kids I nanny for so we wouldn't have to lug our big one back and forth between their houses. At 1 year and 25 lbs, it doesn't look like we'll be able to use it very long. The seat is tiny and the tray is so small. The lip around t is minuscule so food is constantly falling off the sides. This might work as an occasional seat for a petite child but it doesn't fit our needs and will he returned.
customer_reviews.author: Jaci

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Material
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our baby when we found out we could adopt him. It sat in the box in his room for a few months until he was finally old enough to use it around Christmas Eve. First off the material is very flimsy and sleek. There is no cushion for the bottom so the baby can slide out pretty easily. The worst part though is I began to strap it to the chair and THE SAFETY STRAP BROKE AT THE BUCKLE. This meant I couldn’t safely strap it to the chair. Our kid never actually sat in the chair and we’re not comfortable letting him use this seat as it doesn’t seem safe at all.
customer_reviews.author: GingerGrinch

customer_reviews.title: Seems flimsy but works
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a win. We bought this instead of a high chair for when our granddaughter comes to visit. There is nothing cushy about this chair, and the plastic seems flimsy, but the chair works for mealtime, and because it is nearly all plastic, cleaning it up is easy. Probably just forget about the back cover. It doesn't stay on well and is fairly useless. I took one star off for that and also for the way the tray slides on and off--it does not slide smoothly and needs improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Not what I would expect
customer_reviews.text: The size of everything seems very disproportionate. Looking at reviews and pictures it looked great but this is definitely not what I expected. Also the straps are odd lengths and the center one cant be adjusted and its abnormally long. The leg hole is HUGE so my one year old has TONS of space. The tray seems too high, it will work for cheap, but I've found better name brand ones I wish I would have gone with instead. Only real plus is it does gold down so if I need to store it that makes it very easy to do so.
customer_reviews.author: shelbaayy

customer_reviews.title: A great chair for the price, with only 2 complaints.
customer_reviews.text: A very nice booster seat for the money! I ordered two of these highchair/ booster seats, and I only have 2 complaints. The fabric piece on the back, although cute, is pretty useless. It falls off all the time and is so thin that I dont think it does much to cushion the back of the seat anyways. My other complaint is the safety straps loosen VERY easily. To the point of needing to be readjusted every time we use the seat. This is really not that big of an issue for us, as we check the tightness of the straps with every use anyways. Overall an excellent chair for the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie V

customer_reviews.title: Good for grandparents/travel
customer_reviews.text: I like most everything except the safety harness clip fasteners. I have dexterity issues, so having trouble fastening/unfastening my gbaby’s things is nothing new. But Mom and Dad also struggled with them. It took 3 of us to unlock the harness. Locking them is not difficult, but a baby who’s ready to get out while you struggle, is not fun. It would have been nice to have a padded bottom, but I can figure something out for that. For the price, it’s a good little grandparent/travel/high chair/booster.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE!
customer_reviews.text: I love this seat! It is so easy to clean durable, transportable, and comfortable. We have been using it for over a year now, and it is so much better than any high chair I have used. With the bottom section folded up, I can leave the seat strapped to the chair and it slides right in under the table. Or i can leave the bottom section down and it gives my son a little boost to sit up to the table better. I have started removing the tray so that he can slide right up to the table and eat with us now that he is getting bigger and better with silverware. LOVE this seat!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: We already have a highchair, so I just wanted a cheap booster chair for when all the grandbabies are here at the same time. First look and I was disappointed. It's a very straight-backed chair and looked like an uncomfortable doll chair. BUT... come meal time, even the older kids wanted to eat in it. It's small and probably more appropriate for the 6 month to 18 month olds, but even the 2 and 3 year old fit in it. Don't judge this chair by first appearance. It's a dandy little booster chair.
customer_reviews.author: Been There Done That

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Works just as you need it to. Holds the baby no problem. The back pad falls off super easily, but you don’t need it on anyways. The only other thing I’ll add is the tray is not that deep. It barely dips down, so pay attention to the pictures to see if it’s deep enough for what you want. Great product! Works fantastic! My one year old fits in it perfectly, and it folds up easy peasy! I also like that is cleans up really easily. The food wipes right off the plastic. I would recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Katelynn Miller

customer_reviews.title: A Little Tricky
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit hard to unfold and figure out, and it's not easy at all to get the tray on it. It also seems pretty narrow. My grandson is definitely a bit on the skinny side and he fits in it fine, but I think if your baby was a little chubbier, it might be a tight fit. I use this on the floor. He likes to climb in and sit while watching Baby Einstein videos. Then I put the tray on and give him his lunch and let him go to town. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: April Porter

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: A case of "you get what you pay for." The seat is just okay -- I bought it for my family so that when my toddler visits, I don't have to bring one. Pros: Cheap Generally functional Lightweight Cons: Lip on the tray does not stop food from easily getting pushed off to the floor. Latches on the tray to hook into the chair are difficult. Tray comes up to my child's chest, no way to really adjust. If you have a small toddler, not the chair for you. Belt buckle sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina L Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Just ok, not great
customer_reviews.text: Classic case of you get what you pay for. I bought a more expensive booster seat for my first child and got this one for my second. It does its job, in that it straps onto an adult chair and she can eat off the tray, but that's it. The tray is difficult to attach, the fabric on the back slides around (we just removed it), it is difficult to fold down for storage, and the arm rests are too high so she looks cramped sitting in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda R

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! My son will only eat his food in it. I have my highchair I saved for my daughter but he stands up in it. I love that this locks him in place. And when he squirms out, he doesn't fall, because I have him on the floor now. It's just easier for me, he is so squirmy and fussy this is great! But the fabric backing constantly comes off.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Portable and Convenient: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I stumbled upon this high chair. It's small and portable and so convenient. My daughter is a supported sitter which means she will topple over if something isn't there to help her a little bit. (She can sit on her own for about 15 seconds before she tries to reach for something and falls to one side or the other.) This is perfect for a supported sitter. It can be strapped on almost any chair and we've brought it out to restaurants. I bought one for my parents and one for my husband's parents. We all over them. Wonderful purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HempHippie

customer_reviews.title: Works for the price 👍
customer_reviews.text: I like that this being all Plastic is easy to clean unlike our last high chair which was cloth, however I am not a fan of the back cushion bc it's very thin and comes off so easily it won't stay on basically so I've already thrown that part away so now it's just a little too cold and hard so I sit a towl in the bottom. My other issue is the table part only securely attaches at the very back two grooves, with the front ones it's barely on and has fallen off pulling her out
customer_reviews.author: Tigertails

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money! Easy to assemble and clean.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it a few times, but so far, it's great for what I needed! Pros: Super easy assembly out of the box. Folds up small as quickly for easy storage and transport. The tray is easy to attach and remove. The belts are secure without making my little one feel confined. All surfaces are easily cleaned and sanitized. Cons: Doesn't have any padding, so it wouldn't be comfortable for longer sitting times. This does not affect my family how we use it, so this isn't a big deal for me. If I find any others, I will add them!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Probably not a bad product, just don't work for us.
customer_reviews.text: I have irish twins & our dining room is too small for 2 high chairs, so i ordered 2. Received with a cracked arm on one chair and seat pads missing on both. I'm Disappointed. Decided to pack them up for return. I also planned to use the bench with our dining table for them but i wasnt so sure the backs of these seats wouldn't hold up to their weight. I didn't use it so I can't rate versatility or anything else. I pulled them out saw the damage and no seat pads, then packed them back up for return
customer_reviews.author: The Brady bunch 6

customer_reviews.title: very small, cover doesnt stay on; ok as a booster seat - doesnt really replace a high chair
customer_reviews.text: This was the cheapest seat I could find in this style when my littlest started refusing to sit in a regular high chair. Its good enough for the price. the fabric part is a joke and doesnt ever stay on. we threw it away after about 10 minutes. the tray can be a little tricky to get on and its very small compared to a regular high chair. It works for what we use it for but I would suggest if you have the space for a high chair keep your kid in it as long as possible before switching to this tiny thing - until they are big enough to climb in and out themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie D

customer_reviews.title: Simple, awesome little seat
customer_reviews.text: I love that this seat folds up for easy storage/travel . It's simple to put together and take apart and my 8 month old is happy eating his food in it. I didn't want a bulky high chair that takes up alot of space, and I also didn't want to pay alot of money for a small little chair. This fit my needs all the way across the board with price and efficiency. I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Compact - Perfect for On-the-Go
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little chair for on the go. It's not bulky, folds pretty small, and is very lightweight. For that reason, it's not super sturdy either, but is to be expected, given its portability. The straps to secure it to a chair are more than adequate. Tray is on the small side, but again - this isn't a full size chair. It was perfect for us while traveling. On more than one occasion, a restaurant offered us a FILTHY high chair with broken straps. We've put this in the car so we always have a clean seat for our LO.
customer_reviews.author: TampaLyssie

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Seat is nice and compact. Three complaints. The pad only hooks on from the back where it laps over the back. Basically it becomes pointless to have because children discover it comes off and that's exactly what they do. Second is, it's VERY narrow. So if your baby/child is on the bigger side, they may not fit. Third, the armrests are very high to use as a booster. If you have normal chairs and tables, you will not be fitting this under your table in any position other than all the way down.Otherwise the seat functions good.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Super cheap for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: Super flimsy. It's only $16 so that's to be expected but I really don't trust my child in this. The crotch strap also doesn't adjust so my baby just slides down. The fact that the back padding doesn't have a way to secure at the bottom is also super annoying, it fell off like 7 times and I only tried using this for a few hours. It is a good concept just poorly constructed. The photos attached are my son's positioning before and after eating and how much he slouched down as well as him standing with this still attached, he's 7 months old... that shouldn't happen.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: That it’s easy to close and put away without it taking up space, it’s cute. But it’s too small. I bought for my nephew for when he comes over and I baby sit him. He looks very uncomfortable in it. I’m not sure if it’s him wanting to sit that way or if it is the way it’s made he looks like he’s tilting over he looks very awkward when I feed him. But it’s ok you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Blanca👑Nieves

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, tray doesn't stay snapped on
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's just mine, considering all of the reviews. But the tray doesn't snap on and handles are wobbly. I bought this after reading that people used it for travel and outside. It seemed like a great answer to taking my guy to lunch with daddy or even on a picnic. But at 1 year old, he still needs the tray to have his food because plates get thrown. And the tray won't attach properly.
customer_reviews.author: JoJoMama

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic buckles that will fail over time.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, set it up, strapped it to the chair, gave it a little tug ensure it would stay in place and the straps came loose. The buckles are made a very cheap thin plastic. It’s fine to make the rest of it cheap. All the other pieces seemed sturdy but they cheaped out on the most important piece, the buckles. If these buckles worked, I could see that they would eventually fail overtime presenting a danger to your child. I would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Desconfiad

customer_reviews.title: Not the best purchase I have done
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this if you will use it 2 or more times a week. I use it for my grandaughter and is not comfortable at all, this is comparing to the one I use for my grandson same age same number of days a week. I saved like $5.99 and regret doing so and not getting the same one I had purchased for my grandson, it is comfortable to travel from place to place if u go away on weekends.
customer_reviews.author: Adelbeni

customer_reviews.title: cool
customer_reviews.text: awesome chair. My sister in-law used the exact one for 3 of my nieces and nephews. Easy to clean, set up and travel with. Perfect for parents that take there child out of home to be baby sat. the back piece is a thin but relaxing piece that can also be taken off and cleaned. came with extra straps to keep child safe in chair and 2 chair. Tray can be removed as child grows so it turn into a booster. And legs can be put in the make it lower as they grown
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: Overall happy with the seat, I only need it when on vacation and visiting grandparents. It is a little too flimsy for someone to try to use everyday. the straps securing it to the seat are not the best and i would never use it unless sitting right next to the baby and not walking away or turning my back. It was a little difficult the first few times to figure out how to fold it up properly, but once you do it travels nicely and is very compact.
customer_reviews.author: cs

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little seat. I love that my son fits perfectly. I love that it can be used as a small chair. I love that it can be folded and taken anywhere I go. My mom loves it because when the baby has sleep overs at her house or she baby sits it’s easy to install on any of her chairs. It’s very convenient. Specially if you have limited space. It’s a great quality item for the price. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: MsLuna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price for a handsome and durable product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two more of these chairs for our 6 month old twins. Three year old daughter has used the same chair we purchased 2.5 years ago. The old chair has lasted very well and is the primary highchair for our daughter. We also pack it up and travel with it, too. She currently uses the chair as a booster seat because she eats at the table (and... husband accidentally removed the tray too forcefully and snapped the tabs some time ago.) Excellent price for a handsome and durable product.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Kostishak

customer_reviews.title: No frills...so dont expect any
customer_reviews.text: Any negative reviews need to GTFOH. ...its $15. It's exactly what I'd expect for that, it works, it won't last forever and the tray is difficult to get on and off (you have to use both hands -so doing it while holding a baby is a no go), but I think it's worth every penny. Note: make sure to turn you little one to the side and scoot them away from the table or they tend to use their feet to rock back in the chair and can tip over, just an fyi.
customer_reviews.author: MN Mama

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for same day delivery so I’m would have it when my great granddaughter came to visit for a couple of days. We have tried everything. The straps for the inside of the seat will NOT come apart to use. The saying you get what you pay for comes to mind. Cheap and totally unusable in the manner it was supposed to be for 0 star for being able to use it safely!!
customer_reviews.author: kathy conrad

customer_reviews.title: Not a great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It works but I am giving it only one star because it was poorly engineered. You have to push TWO buttons at the same time (one in each side) in order to slide the tray out while using your leg to pin it down. Not very smart considering this will be used by someone that will be holding a baby. Also the cute cover doesn't stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for travel
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use for travel. Had hoped to keep out andxreplace our buliker highchaor, but the lip on this one isn't as high, so our toddler just swipes his food off (intentionally, mind you... but much more tempting with the low sides). Its a little hard to wipe down because of nooks andcrannies, but is easy to olace in sink, and we did this once a week. Ultimately decided to switch back to karger one fo daily use, but his is still a nice chaircand folds up so small and light for travel!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for smaller living quarters
customer_reviews.text: I got this so as to have a better way to start feeding my baby more solid foods with less mess on her. Before I was using a bumbo chair. She fits fine at four months and there is minimal cloth for easier clean up. Has grips at the feet, is adjustable and both the cloth back and tray are the appropriate machine washable. I did have to figure out how to put together and take apart myself though for the instructions aren't very clear. I have a small apartment and don't have room for a high chair so this was a great option for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product after being impressed with so many good reviews. But a month s use or so I am not happy. first of all the chair had few scratches when arrived,pics attached. We tried to ignore it and use the product. My daughter had bruises on her private part coz of the middle harness even with diaper. If I don't put that harness ,she slips of. now we have stopped using it.
customer_reviews.author: Sneha

customer_reviews.title: A great option to have!
customer_reviews.text: We could not decide on a high chair and because our dining area is small, we decided to start baby with this space saving booster seat. We love it! I am sure a quality high chair will be great, but so far it works really well for us right now and looks great on our dining chair. Its extrememly minimal and blends in with our neutral decor. I hope we will be able to continue using it until baby is older and not have to switch to a large high chair!
customer_reviews.author: hl1000

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling, eating or fishing!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this portable high chair. I used it for my son for eating when we were visiting my grand parents in Florida including using the tray. Upon arriving back home up north we already had a high chair so we actually took off the tray and put the seat part in our boat and now he sits comfortably while learning to fish!!! straps onto almost any chair or bench with ease. It is easy to use and is great for travel. I would absolutely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: This booster is awesome. I definitely recommend it. Not perfect, but...nothing is. Pros: compact and lightweight easy to clean folds under the table without having to detach from chair (BEST. THING. EVER.) affordable Cons: cloth cover for seat back comes off way too easily folding down is a breeze but unfolding can get tricky because the back part of the seat gets stuck/jammed in the track sliding the tray portion on can be difficult Highly recommend and would for sure buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith S.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: this works for what it's intended to, and provides a clean space for baby when we're out at restaurants. It's nice that it folds down and is pretty portable, so we keep it in the trunk and pull it out whenever it's needed. It would be nice if the tray attached to the top instead of the bottom when it's in the folded position, and the seat pad is also a little clumsy and falls off easily - it would be nice if there was a better way to secure it.
customer_reviews.author: duckie

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality for the price and compact
customer_reviews.text: We got this for grandmom’s house And it’s perfect for our 5 month old. It can fold up for visiting family. Easy to set up and clean. It is small so not sure how well it may fit larger older children but I’m guessing my son will be able to fit in it for at least another year. UPDATE: My son is 16 months now and still fits in it with room to grow. Sometimes I use it as a booster seat so he can sit at the kitchen table to color. We loved it so much that we bought a second one to be his main high chair at home too.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, small tray. Good for small baby.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Was a little nervous to use this at first because it didn't seem very sturdy. I wanted to send it back before I even put it together because of cheap plastic which did not look like it could hold my baby. After assembly it was fine, and baby is happy in it. Keep in mind it's small, and the tray is small too. I don't think I will keep it for a long time though, I think the baby will outgrow the small tray.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha R.

customer_reviews.title: great portable chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is a great size. Not too small, but small enough to not take up a ton of space. It fits my babies as well as my large 37 pound toddler. The tray is easy to use and we don't use it when the toddler is in the chair, we just push her up to the table. It has straps for the bottom of the chair and the back of the chair, so it's very well secured. I'm not sure how well the fabric back washes up... I don't use it since it doesn't secure on very well and the toddler likes to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: Krista.B

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: This seat is not as sturdy as I had hoped it would be. I'm afraid my grandson will tip over in it as it does not seem as weight balanced as other seats I am familiar with. In order to attach the tray, it requires my husband to hold the seat, while I struggle to attach, or remover, the tray. I will not be using this seat and will be purchasing a more expensive seat that I feel more comfortable with that will provide more safety. Will probably let the kids play with this seat for their dolls or stuffed animals only.
customer_reviews.author: Jacalynn Wade

customer_reviews.title: Great feeding seat for occational use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandbaby to use when I watch her. I love that it folds flat when not in use, even the tray connects to the back making it easy to store. It wipes clean easily and I like how there is no cushion on the bottom of the seat, which is great because my grandbaby wastes food in her lap often so I only have to wipe it up.
customer_reviews.author: LadyLibra

customer_reviews.title: Great as a travel booster
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take on vacation and to use as an extra when needed like for holidays. I was nervous about the quality because of the low cost, but I am pleasantly surprised! It is durable and folds up nicely in an already packed car. My 15 month old fits in it nicely. It has straps for him as well as straps to secure to a kitchen chair.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, especially for the price! I needed something small and compact to bring on vacation. Love how it folded right up and I was able to strap it into our infant car seat and pack it in a car seat bag and put on the plane. Cleans up very easily and fit securely on all chairs we tried. Also very sturdy when set alone on the ground without a chair. We will be bringing it camping with us this summer. It’s nice to enjoy a meal without a little one always in your lap.
customer_reviews.author: farmmom

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my twin grandsons and absolutely love them! Fantastic price and so cute! Not big and bulky and their parents keep them in their car so they will always have a seat for the twins wherever they go! Can be used on the floor, in a booth or in a chair, has securing straps for that or even on the ground! Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Rimer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this so my daughter would have a chair at our family’s house across the country and it works just as good as the expensive ones!!! (She is 11 months now but used it at 6 months old). The vision on the back is thin, but you don’t really need it, it’s more for decorations! They are too busy worrying about food anyways!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Family

customer_reviews.title: Good option for short term/grandma’s house
customer_reviews.text: We ordered for our Airbnb, and it worked fine for a week, but I wouldn’t want this to be my every day chair. The padding is flimsy and doesn’t stay put. Baby can easily remove it. The chair sits very upright, with no recline. If you don’t strap this to a chair, and try to use it on the floor, baby can push back and fall over. Great price and value for a secondary chair at grandma’s or for a vacation, but wouldn’t recommend for long term/daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is a convenient seat, but smaller than I expected. My 9-month-old granddaughter fits in it perfectly now, but she probably won't for much longer. And the tray is tiny, which means a lot of messes end up on the floor. Highly recommend a "splat mat" with this product. Tray is also not as easy as I'd like to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my mom to have at her house for my 13 month old baby boy. He is on the smaller side (21lbs and 28.5 inches) and he JUST fits in it. I am returning because he won't be able to use it very long at all. It also didn't come in the original box, it was just in the shipping box by itself and there were no instructions. It was fairly easy to figure out, but it still would've been nice to have instructions.
customer_reviews.author: acstanos

customer_reviews.title: My favorite chair
customer_reviews.text: Perfection in the form of a baby chair. Practical, worry free and easy to clean, my baby loves it. One of my favorite stuff I've buy for my baby as a preemie. I have another style of chair, but this one is my favorite and less expensive. I use it to train my baby to eat, and for painting/drafting, playing etc. She is 15 months and I discovered this chair when she was 12. Such a same I didn't have it before. I was struggling with the other chair all the time when trying to remove her as that one wasn't wide open on the legs (sometimes she got hurt). But, this is a good chair.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Good for vacation
customer_reviews.text: Needed a cheapie Hugh chair for a vacation. Worked great, but I didn’t trust it to walk away with baby strapped in it. But made feeding easy at a good price. I got my son the pink one because pink was cheaper. Weird that the blue cost more. He’s 7 months he doesn’t care about the color & I didn’t want to spend a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: The Hirtes

customer_reviews.title: Nice buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice little high chair for the money. I am going to start watching my grand-daughter and this is just what I was looking for. It takes up no space at all and is sturdy and secure. I highly rec. this item. The only downside is I bought it for $18.99 and just a few days later it was priced at $16.00...wish there was an option for a refund of difference when something is listed lower than what you paid in the window of a few days, but still very happy.
customer_reviews.author: DML 59

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality and price💗
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing! It’s super compact and is great for toddler to sit at the table (without the tray). We also use it to sit on the floor. It’s super easy to move around and not bulky! The buckles are sturdy and she can’t escape. Super easy to clean and the cover I don’t mind. It comes off easily but isn’t hard to keep on. The quality for the price is outstanding. It’s a must have for us!
customer_reviews.author: Good SAHM

customer_reviews.title: your basic baby seat
customer_reviews.text: although the box was damaged upon delivery, the actual product was fine thank goodness. this seat is exactly as advertised. its just a basic seat to feed the baby and help with sitting up. it has two sets of straps to secure it to a chair. the seat is plastic, nothing fancy or expensive. im very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Racquelle

customer_reviews.title: Durable, but bulky and difficult to collapse
customer_reviews.text: Pros: ...durable ...good weight limit ...durable straps Cons: ...difficult to clean; too many small grooves ...difficult to collapse. If you’re going to keep it set up, it’s great! To break it down or fold it up and clean it, it has snapped my nails, and been pretty frustrating. ...when it is collapsed, it’s pretty bulky I kept it as a permanently set-up chair, but I would recommend a collapsible camp-chair-style high chair.
customer_reviews.author: BWW

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had gotten a different one
customer_reviews.text: It is a okay chair for the price but I don’t like it. The back is completely straight and there is nothing on the seat to help keep my baby from sliding down some and then it’s hard for him to eat. The tray takes two hands to use so if your baby is fussy or wiggle it’s almost impossible it get the tray to work.
customer_reviews.author: D. Towns

customer_reviews.title: Works for us and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Loving this booster seat. My 12mo daughter hates the high chair so we decided on this. She’s more comfortable on here & I love that it’s portable. No need to buy a separate item for when you go out to lunch/dinner. No need to use the dirty restaurant high chairs. This was affordable and useful in so many ways. Good buy for us.
customer_reviews.author: zoeyzoey

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, returning
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed with this booster seat, especially because it had such great reviews. I was hoping it was like my Fisher-Price one, but less expensive but it is just plain less expensive and poorly made. The plastic seems cheap like it would crack eventually. Plus, it is very difficult to fold up. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our 2 year old twins. We LOVE them. We use them every day. Takes up so much less room than our initial seats. Small and compact which is nice for travel. Easy to clean. We haven’t brought them to a restaurant because of the pandemic but these would be great for that since restaurant high chairs don’t typically contain our little monkeys!
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was ecstatic when I found this seat, I thought the price was too good to pass up and wanted an extra chair for my in laws house. I immediately regretted getting it. The chair is so flimsy I am almost afraid to have my daughter in there. I get that this is a cheaper chair, but I didn't anticipate it being so cheap I fear letting her sit in there alone, turning my back for a quick second. If i were you, I would spend the extra $10 for a more sturdy, bigger chair.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie K

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little sitter for when you need one on the go. We store it in our vehicle for when we go out to restaurants etc and do not want to use theirs because who knows when they last cleaned it. Plus this is so cheap it basically pays for it self. Well worth the investment. Only issue I see if that it doesn’t have enough cushioning and I wish it could lengthen the legs
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: It's easily the top 5 most helpful tools to the parents. A lot of products claim they are helpful, but we found this one particularly does the job, and wonder why we didn't buy it earlier. We take it whenever we eat outside of the home. It's quick to assemble, takes small space to store and avoids us having to clean the high chairs outside from time to time-- in fact, we never use restaurants' high chairs any more. The kid may outgrow it, but it's def a solid solid deal.
customer_reviews.author: NPR

customer_reviews.title: Great Foldable portable chair!
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be SO much better than I expected. It is small, sturdy & fantastic. I babysit 9-month-old twin boys and needed a chair to feed them but didn't have a lot of space for a regular high chair. When this arrived it only took a minute to figure out how to unfold and re-fold. For someone who travels with little ones a lot or like me, who babysits, this is fantastic
customer_reviews.author: NamiesBooks

customer_reviews.title: multipurpose infant seat
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about getting an activity seat for my 5 month old. I decided to get this so it could be used for a longer period as a high chair/booster. Since it was so cheap I was able to purchase suction toys to put on the tray and and it was still cheaper than most baby activity seats that babies quickly out grow.
customer_reviews.author: Kiersten Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy
customer_reviews.text: Hi pinks! I bought this summer infant folding booster seat few weeks back. It is so comfortable to use and easy to carry. We often go visit our family in the weekends and we could take it with us every time without any hassel. It looks exactly the way it is in the pictures. I really liked the pink colour. The strap attachments are good quality and easy to adjust. I use just the booster seat to fed my baby by its own and find it easy. I haven't tried using it as a booster seat on a dining table chair. If I use it I will update my review with my opinion. Thank you With Love Sindhu
customer_reviews.author: Sindhu

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I’ve been babysitting my niece and I really have nowhere to put her when I have to do things without her and she been super clingy but I started putting some snacks and sticking her in there and she likes it now she won’t even eat without sitting there now. It’s a little flimsy but it works if you’re using it for a grand child, niece, nephew, or some kind a family member that comes over often. Folds up really nicely takes up little room which is a good thing. Overall Good valuefor the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lizz

customer_reviews.title: Good and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Overall the quality is okay, the plastic is a little thin and cheap; the seat is a little narrow which is for a small butt. The back cover is a thin cloth layer, no cushion. However, it is very convenient to carry around. Easily to bring it to my parent's house, friend's house, or a restaurant ( if you don't like the high chair they provided, then it is clean and for your baby use only). Plus, it is a very good price. I cannot ask too much due to the cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: good travel seat to attach to the right chair
customer_reviews.text: Much cheaper than the Bumbo we had for our eldest. The tray can go in the dishwasher. The straps can come out and go in the washing machine. The whole seat can fold up for transport. So it's great to travel with. It's a little hard to secure to some chairs, however. The straps could stand to be a little longer and adjust a little shorter. But it contains the mess for our baby to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Besa

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the most bang for your buck. The picture printed on the back is slightly fuzzy and low quality, but the chair itself works great. It had great rubber feet and slides much less than the Bumbo did, so much that I feel comfortable using it on my table top. While it does fold, it's not easy to do and it's more convenient to leave it up all the time. However, it's not very big anyways as it takes up about as much room as the Bumbo did. You can't get much better than this for $15!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hess

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Remember - you pay for what you get! You can't buy this affordable seat and compare it to a seat that's triple the price. That being said, I'm really happy with this purchase! I had a different seat from my son, but it was too big to scoot the chair under the table. I wanted to get something so that my son could actually eat on the table with me, not just on the tray. Remember, this seat is small and may not accommodate for bigger toddlers. My son is 1 year old and 18 pounds and ~27 inches long. He's tiny, so this is perfect and I can see us using it for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Ness

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, fold and take along! We use this as our travel booster. Yes it is made of light weight plastic but safety is not compromised. It is sturdy. I did remove the cheaply made and looking fabric cover. We put the tray in the dishwasher often facing up. For the price, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for travel or easy set up & put away
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. The seat cover is the only thing that makes it seem cheap. It doesn’t actually fit over the whole seat. It’s just a little pad that can easily come off but that’s also good for easy clean up. I would recommend! It can definitely condense down good for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie Brigman

customer_reviews.title: Buy It
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my nephew for our house and loved it so much that I ordered one for my girlfriend out in Arizona that had a baby that fell on hard times and she loved it. So easy to use.. you can’t beat the price. I actually gave mine away when my nephew grew out. If I ever have another baby.. I’ll bbe ordering my third one of these. They clean up nice
customer_reviews.author: SaraS

customer_reviews.title: Wish we would've bought sooner!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. We don't have a large house and everyone kept tripping over the old highchair, literally! I love this seat! We have it in a stool and it works great. It would be awesome on a chair but our baby pulls everything down within a 50 mile radius so a stool works best for our family and just pull her away from the island. Cleans up so easily! Must buy for the price 👌
customer_reviews.author: louise

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price, great height
customer_reviews.text: Needed something for grandma's. This is amazing! Folds fairly small, I would put in a suitcase or car, even a restaurant if I know they don't have highchairs. Mostly easy to clean, some of the crevices are hard to get to but can even be washed in tub (or large sink). Love the 2 heights, with or without legs, makes it easier to adjust for different tables/chairs.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size & excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: Just right for travel, this works for our 6 month old who cannot sit up by herself, the baby can't slouch down due to the placement of the straps and the high sides, and there's room for baby to grow! Works great for feeding baby anywhere and she loves to sit and play with her toys on the tray! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Wow ! Love this little tuck away seat
customer_reviews.text: Recieved today for my grandson and I am very impressed it folds up nicely. Nice quality durable plastic I was really worried it would be flimsy but its not. My only complaint is the back pad is very small and thin and feels cheap. But the chair itself really impressed me would buy again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey  Harris

customer_reviews.title: Good as a backup and for travel
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a second chair around the house that I can use on the floor or carry it outside. This is awesome. It may not be very sturdy on a chair, but for my purpose, this works. My 2 year old toddler can carry this and bring it to where ever i ask to keep it. Pretty light weight. The height is the tray is very good. My 2 year old is very tall and his legs don't hit the tray like I have seen other ones do.
customer_reviews.author: mst

customer_reviews.title: Always use this! So convienet
customer_reviews.text: We love this travel booster.. It breaks down so easily and is super easy to get thrown up in a couple minutes. There is one under my desk at work that my daughter uses in the morning (obviously not under my desk in use ) And I got one for my grandmas house because it takes up so little room and all my nieces and nephews can use. The plastic is so convenient to wipe down!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Koz

customer_reviews.title: Seat too deep and tray too shallow
customer_reviews.text: I feel the seat is too deep for my 33” tall girl 19 month old. The tray ends up too far up so that her elbows are pushed up and makes it difficult to use utensils or bowls. I’m going to try putting a folded towel under her tomorrow. The tray is annoying to adjust and too small to hold much. The rim of try is too shallow so it really won’t keep food or plates on the tray. I will keep it only because it was inexpensive and will only be used a few times a year while visiting grandparents out of state.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: We ordered this booster to take with us on vacation because it folds up quite nicely. We did use it
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2 year old. We ordered this booster to take with us on vacation because it folds up quite nicely. We did use it, but not as much as we thought. The problem is the tray. There is no logical way to secure the tray to the seat when it is folded up. But if we don't use the tray, the booster itself is not tall enough for a toddler to sit comfortably at a normal table. We decided it was not worth the hassle of bringing it back with us home and left it on permanent vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost Leader

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This has been very easy to clean, prettt easy to fold, but a great size for travel. My down side is that flimsy cover and lack of padding. I wish it had a better cushion for the back. I also wish it would better attach to the hair as it is easily moved/pushed aside by a squirming toddler. But I love the price and it has served its purpose well .
customer_reviews.author: Regan Burford

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for campers
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use in our camper and it is the perfect size. We sit it on our dinette seat next to use and our 9 month old is comfortable. He will most likely grow out of it soon, he is about 20 pounds now. Just a heads up this is NOT secure just sitting on something it needs to be strapped down because it could tip over.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Foster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grandparents
customer_reviews.text: I love the compactness of this seat. It fits very snugly on chairs, no matter what type. The tray and seat a very easy to clean. The only small criticism is I never recall how to fold it back up and always have to check the manual. I own two of these for my twin grandsons and highly recommend. It is nice that they fold up fairly small for storage when grandsons are not around and my house goes back to adult living!
customer_reviews.author: Debra A. Haffey

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love love love this product! I am a mum on the go and it fits on any chair and it's easy to assemble and adjust if you need to, my baby is so comfortable In it wayyy better than the highchair. I feel alot more comfortable knowing I have this when we both are up and about. This product is easy to pack up in the car and it doesn't take up much space but what made me absolutely love this product is that I was able to use it in the car itself..this product is affordable and a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: You don't need a highchair, just get one of these!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little chair. We use it all the time at my parents instead of a full high chair, and have taken it when we go around for family get-togethers. I honestly wish I had just registered for two of these instead of the high chair we have at home because this did everything the high chair did with far less bulk and cost.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: What I need to get is a sturdy wooden chair to place it on
customer_reviews.text: Was going to return as the seat looks flimsy. But when I saw it at the OTHER grandma's house, I knew it was tried and true. What I need to get is a sturdy wooden chair to place it on. (I have only upholstered dining chairs.) I'll find one in a thrift store and that will solve the problem. This seat is easy to clean, adapts from tots to toddlers, folds up for storage. Cost-wise, found the best price here.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: A small kitchen must / easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Simple. Small, but effective. We use this as our everyday high chair as we have an eat-in kitchen and do not a lot of extra space for a free-standing high chair. We love this. It puts our baby at the perfect height to have his own tray but eat at the table with us. It cleans up easily and once a week we take off the chair and give it a full wash and rinse in the sink. I love that it grows with our baby and can be a basic booster seat in the final stage. Travels well. And you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christa Cillaroto

product_meta.title: Summer Deluxe Comfort Folding Booster Seat, Tan
product_meta.description:
Color:TanThe Summer Infant Deluxe Comfort Folding Booster Seat is a convenient, comfortable solution for eating in-home or on-the-go. With its compact fold, the booster is perfect for travel. The machine washable cover provides additional comfort. Do not use on a stool, an unstable chair or folding chair

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: 2-in-1: infant feeding seat with tray becomes a toddler booster seat at table
2-level height adjustment for your growing child
3-point restraint system with chair straps to secure booster to chair
Ultra compact folding design for storage and portability with removable machine-washable seat pad

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars6,509 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
